revision.comment: Reverted 1 pending edit by [[Special:Contributions/211.30.110.236|211.30.110.236]] to revision 852303095 by Daß Wölf
revision.text:
{{pp-pc1}} {{Use Australian English|date=February 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Rebel Wilson | image = Rebel Wilson (6707611099) (cropped).jpg | caption = Wilson at the [[Sydney]] premiere of
''[[A Few Best Men]]'', January 2012 | birth_name = {{nowrap|Melanie Elizabeth Bownds}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1980|03|02|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]] | residence = [[West Hollywood, California]], U.S. | alma_mater = [[University of New South Wales]] | occupation = {{hlist|Actress|Writer|Producer|Singer}} | years_active = 2002–present }} '''Rebel Melanie Elizabeth Wilson'''{{efn|According to the [[Australian Electoral Commission|Australian Electoral Roll]], she was born Melanie Elizabeth Bownds.{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/lifestyle/celebrity/ls-celebrity-news/rebel-wilsons-birth-date-revealed-in-asic-documents-20150519-gh5caq.html|title=Rebel Wilson's birth date revealed in ASIC documents|last1=Aubusson|first1=Kate|date=20 May 2015|work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|accessdate=19 May 2015|quote=Business records filed with the Australian Securities and Investment Commission (ASIC) list the date of birth for a "Rebel Melanie Elizabeth Wilson" as March 2, 1980}}{{cite news|url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/ipad/the-qa-with-actor-rebel-wilson/story-fn6bn9st-1226199246884|title=The Q&A with actor Rebel Wilson|last=Miller|first=Megan|date=19 November 2011|work=[[Herald Sun]]|accessdate=13 August 2013|publisher=[[The Herald and Weekly Times]]}} In later years she adopted "Rebel"–a childhood [[nickname]]–as her first name and changed her [[surname]] to Wilson. She retained her first two given names as [[middle name]]s.{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/lifestyle/celebrity/ls-celebrity-news/rebel-wilsons-birth-date-revealed-in-asic-documents-20150519-gh5caq.html|title=Rebel Wilson's birth date revealed in ASIC documents|last1=Aubusson|first1=Kate|date=20 May 2015|work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|accessdate=19 May 2015|quote=Business records filed with the Australian Securities and Investment Commission (ASIC) list the date of birth for a "Rebel Melanie Elizabeth Wilson" as March 2, 1980}}{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/article/rebel-wilson-age-name-melanie-elizabeth-bownds|title=Facts vs. Fibs: Rebel Wilson's Real Age is 35, Records Confirm|last=Fowler|first=Tara|date=20 May 2015|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=Time|accessdate=21 May 2015|quote=The Australian Electoral Roll lists her real name as Melanie Elizabeth Bownds, though she later changed her last name to Wilson, as has been previously reported. Last year, however, she told The Australian Women's Weekly that her real name was in fact Rebel, and that Melanie and Elizabeth were middle names she went by at school to avoid being teased.}}|group=note}} (born 2 March 1980) is an Australian actress, writer, and producer. After graduating from the [[Australian Theatre for Young People]] in 2003, she began appearing as Toula on the [[Special Broadcasting Service]] (SBS) comedy series ''[[Pizza (TV series)|Pizza]]'' and the [[sketch comedy]] series ''[[The Wedge (Australian TV series)|The Wedge]]''. In 2008, Wilson wrote, produced and starred in the musical comedy series ''[[Bogan Pride]]''. The following year, she won the [[Tropfest]] best actress award for her role in ''Bargain'' and made a guest appearance in ''[[City Homicide]]''. Shortly after moving to the United States, Wilson was cast as Brynn in the feature film ''[[Bridesmaids (2011 film)|Bridesmaids]]''. Wilson also appeared in ''[[A Few Best Men]]'', ''[[What to Expect When You're Expecting (film)|What to Expect When You're Expecting]]'' and ''[[Struck by Lightning (2012 film)|Struck by Lightning]]'', leading ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' to name her one of their "Top Ten Comics to Watch for 2011". She also appeared as Becky in ''[[Bachelorette (film)|Bachelorette]]'' and starred in the musical comedy ''[[Pitch Perfect (film series)|Pitch Perfect]]'' [[film series]] as Fat Amy, a role that earned her several award nominations and wins, including the MTV Best Breakthrough Performance Award and a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Actress. She has also created and starred in ''[[Super Fun Night]]'', a television comedy that aired for one season on [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]. == Early life and education == Wilson was born in 2 March 1980{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/lifestyle/celebrity/ls-celebrity-news/rebel-wilsons-birth-date-revealed-in-asic-documents-20150519-gh5caq.html|title=Rebel Wilson's birth date revealed in ASIC documents|last1=Aubusson|first1=Kate|date=20 May 2015|work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|accessdate=19 May 2015|quote=Business records filed with the Australian Securities and Investment Commission (ASIC) list the date of birth for a "Rebel Melanie Elizabeth Wilson" as March 2, 1980}} in [[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]], Australia.{{cite web |url = http://www.biography.com/people/rebel-wilson-21187753 |title = Rebel Wilson |website = Biography.com }} Her mother is a [[professional handler|professional dog handler]].{{cite web |title = Nangunyah |url = https://www.dogzonline.com.au/breeds/member.asp?name=NANGUNYAH |website = dogzonline.com.au |accessdate = 21 May 2015 }}{{cite episode |title = Rebel Wilson on Her Family |url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=astcvS4QCfQ |series = [[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]] |network = [[NBCUniversal]] |quote = I've got two sisters, Liberty and Annachi and my brother Ryot...and what's her [mother's] name? Sue. |airdate = 11 November 2013 }} Wilson grew up in the suburbs of [[Kenthurst, New South Wales|Kenthurst]], [[Parramatta]] and [[Castle Hill, New South Wales|Castle Hill]].{{cite news |url = http://www.theage.com.au/news/tv--radio/bboganvilleb-dont-mock-the-moccasins/2008/06/16/1213468329184.html |title = Don't be mocking the moccasins. |date = 17 June 2008 |work = [[The Age]] |accessdate = 24 December 2013 }} She attended [[Tara Anglican School for Girls]].{{cite news|url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/ipad/the-qa-with-actor-rebel-wilson/story-fn6bn9st-1226199246884|title=The Q&A with actor Rebel Wilson|last=Miller|first=Megan|date=19 November 2011|work=[[Herald Sun]]|accessdate=13 August 2013|publisher=[[The Herald and Weekly Times]]}}{{cite web |url = https://www.elle.com.au/culture/elle-interview-rebel-wilson-7664 |title = Elle interview: Rebel Wilson |date = 17 December 2013 |work = [[Elle (magazine)|Elle Australia]] |accessdate = 24 December 2013 }}{{cite web |url = http://movieline.com/2012/09/07/bridesmaids-bachelorette-rebel-wilson-pitch-perfect-interview |title = From Bridesmaids To Bachelorette: Why Rebel Wilson Is The Most Interesting Woman In Hollywood |publisher = Movieline.com |date = 7 September 2012 |first = Jen |last = Yamato |accessdate = 21 August 2014 }} She completed her [[Higher School Certificate (New South Wales)|Higher School Certificate]] in 1997, including second place in the state in food technology.{{cite web |title = Food Technology 2 unit |url = http://www.boardofstudies.nsw.edu.au/ebos/static/OM_CM_1997_12_21870.htm |website = boardofstudies.nsw.ed |accessdate = 19 May 2015 }} Wilson has three siblings: sisters Liberty and Annaleise (who uses the name "Annachi") and a brother, who uses the name "Ryot".{{cite news |url = http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/lifestyle/sunday-magazine/winning-laughs-and-losing-weight/story-e6frf039-1226186071421 |title = Winning Laughs and Losing Weight |last = Field |first = Melissa |date = 6 November 2011 |work = [[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]] |publisher = News Limited |accessdate = 1 January 2013 }}{{cite video |people = Rebel Wilson, Craig Ferguson |title = The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson |work = [[The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson]] |publisher = [[Worldwide Pants Incorporated]] |date = 3 June 2011 |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }}{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2017/jun/01/rebel-wilsons-siblings-argue-family-has-tradition-of-unusual-names-at-trial|title=Rebel Wilson's siblings argue family has tradition of 'unusual' names at trial|date=1 June 2017|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=8 June 2018}} Liberty and Ryot appeared on the [[The Amazing Race Australia 1|first season]] of ''[[The Amazing Race Australia]]'' in 2011, where they were the first team eliminated.{{cite news |url = http://www.couriermail.com.au/ipad/rebel-sets-pace-for-siblings/story-fn6ck8la-1226056983991 |title = Rebel sets pace for siblings |last = Shearer |first = Geoff |date = 17 May 2011 |work = [[The Courier-Mail]] |publisher = [[Queensland Newspapers]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }} Wilson has stated that her great-aunt was [[Lillian Bounds]], who was married to [[Walt Disney]] until his death in 1966.{{cite web |url = https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/weekend/entertainment/2013/10/11/funny-girl-rebel-wilson/2965553 |title = Funny girl Rebel Wilson's 'Super Fun Night' inspiration |publisher = USA Today |date = 11 October 2013 |first = Nancy |last = Mills |accessdate = 21 August 2014 }} Despite Wilson standing by this belief in court,{{cite web |url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/06/15/rebel-wilson-wins-age-defamation-lawsuit-rapping-court/ |title = Rebel Wilson wins defamation case after rapping, joking and crying during bizarre court performance |last = Pearlman |first = Jonathan |date = 15 June 2017 |work = [[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]] |accessdate = 17 June 2017 }} it continues to be disputed by genealogist Dale Sheldon.{{cite web |url = https://nz.news.yahoo.com/rebel-wilson-isnt-disney-genealogist-173100034--spt.html |title = Rebel Wilson isn't a Disney: genealogist |website = yahoo.com |accessdate = 8 June 2018 }} Wilson's first career choice was mathematics. She told ''[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]'', "I was very academic at high school and was always good with numbers."{{cite news |url = http://newsstore.fairfax.com.au/apps/viewDocument.ac?page=1&sy=age&kw=Rebel+Wilson+and+University&pb=all_ffx&dt=selectRange&dr=entire&so=relevance&sf=text&sf=headline&rc=10&rm=200&sp=nrm&clsPage=1&docID=SMH020529M6EBJ21STPN |title = A push over on stage |last = Wilson |first = Vanessa |date = 29 May 2002 |work = [[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |publisher = [[Fairfax Media]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 |quote = That lead to the 22-year-old's first play, The Westie Monologues, and her springboard to life as a playwright. And actor. And producer. And theatre company director. }} She attended the [[University of New South Wales]], graduating in 2009 with [[Bachelor of Arts]] (Theatre and Performance Studies) and [[Bachelor of Laws]] degrees.{{cite web |title = Leaders |url = https://www.arts.unsw.edu.au/alumni-supporters/alumni/leaders |website = www.arts.unsw.edu.au |accessdate = 20 May 2015 }} A former [[Rotary International]] Youth Ambassador for Australia, she was based in South Africa for one year, where she contracted [[malaria]].{{cite web |url = http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118040424?refCatId=19 |title = 10 Comics to Watch – Rebel Wilson: Oz Star Gets ''Bridesmaids'' Boost |last = Blair |first = Iain |date = 26 July 2011 |work = [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |publisher = [[Reed Business Information]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20121108233134/http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118040424?refCatId=19 |archivedate = 8 November 2012 }} She has spoken of malaria-induced hallucinations, where she saw herself as an actress who had won an [[Academy Award|Oscar]], convincing her to pursue an acting career. == Career == === Early career (2002–10) === Wilson studied at the [[Australian Theatre for Young People]] (ATYP).{{cite web |url = http://www.sbs.com.au/shows/boganpride/cast/detail/id/8 |title = Meet the cast – Rebel Wilson |publisher = [[Special Broadcasting Service]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }} In 2003 she moved to New York after winning the ATYP International scholarship, which was funded by [[Nicole Kidman]]. While she was in New York, Wilson trained with [[The Second City]].{{cite news |url = http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2002/09/24/1032734164283.html |title = Rebel off to New York to hone comic craft |last = Pryor |first = Lisa |date = 25 September 2002 |work = [[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |publisher = [[Fairfax Media]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }}{{cite web |url = http://www.contactmusic.com/news/rebel-wilson-credits-nicole-kidman-with-movie-career_1229895 |title = Rebel Wilson Credits Nicole Kidman With Movie Career |date = 30 June 2011 |publisher = [[Contactmusic.com]] |accessdate = 15 April 2013 }} She appeared with the [[Sydney Theatre Company]] and performed at the [[Melbourne International Comedy Festival]]. She first came to the public's attention in 2002 with her stage musical ''The Westie Monologues'', which she wrote,{{cite web |last1 = Bownds |first1 = Melanie Elizabeth |title = The Westie Monologues |url = http://www.ipaustralia.com.au/applicant/bownds-melanie-elizabeth/trademarks/878718 |website = ipaustralia.com.au |accessdate = 19 May 2015 }} starred in and produced in Sydney.{{cite news |url = http://newsstore.fairfax.com.au/apps/viewDocument.ac?page=1&sy=age&kw=Rebel+Wilson+and+University&pb=all_ffx&dt=selectRange&dr=entire&so=relevance&sf=text&sf=headline&rc=10&rm=200&sp=nrm&clsPage=1&docID=SMH021125D24F90EPAMU |title = Rebel with a cause to liberate westies by poking fun |last = Verity |first = William |date = 25 November 2002 |work = [[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |publisher = [[Fairfax Media]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }} Her follow-up stage productions, which she wrote, produced and starred in include ''Spunks'' and ''Confessions of an Exchange Student''.{{cite news |url = http://newsstore.fairfax.com.au/apps/viewDocument.ac?page=1&sy=age&kw=Rebel+Wilson+and+Confessions+of+an+Exchange+Student&pb=all_ffx&dt=selectRange&dr=entire&so=relevance&sf=text&sf=headline&rc=10&rm=200&sp=nrm&clsPage=1&docID=AGE0504097N2885VQGS6 |title = Comedy |last = Bragge |first = Lily |date = 9 April 2005 |work = [[The Age]] |publisher = [[Fairfax Media]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }} In Australia, Wilson is most known for her roles as Toula on the [[SBS (Australian TV channel)|SBS]] comedy series ''[[Pizza (TV series)|Pizza]]'' and as various characters including Lucy, Fat Mandi and Karla Bangs on the sketch comedy series ''[[The Wedge (Australian TV series)|The Wedge]]''. She played an ''[[Australian Idol]]'' mad schoolgirl in a series of [[Telstra]] advertisements shown during ''Australian Idol'' from 2004 to 2005.{{cite web |url = http://www.tvtonight.com.au/2008/10/bogan-pride.html |title = Bogan Pride |last = Knox |first = David |date = 2 October 2008 |publisher = [[TV Tonight]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }} She also had roles in the feature films ''[[Fat Pizza]]'' and ''[[Ghost Rider (film)|Ghost Rider]]''.{{cite news |url = http://www.watoday.com.au/articles/2008/09/23/1221935644974.html |title = Pride of place in bogan-ville |last = McManus |first = Bridget |date = 25 September 2008 |work = [[WAtoday]] |publisher = [[Fairfax Media]] |accessdate = 16 July 2011 }} In 2008, Wilson created, wrote, produced and starred in the musical comedy series ''[[Bogan Pride]]'' on SBS One and also starred in the improvisational [[Nine Network]] series ''[[Monster House (Australian TV series)|Monster House]]''. In 2009 Wilson won the [[Tropfest]] Best Actress award for her role in the film ''Bargain''.{{cite news |url = http://newsstore.fairfax.com.au/apps/viewDocument.ac?page=1&sy=age&kw=Rebel+Wilson+and+Tropfest&pb=all_ffx&dt=selectRange&dr=entire&so=relevance&sf=text&sf=headline&rc=10&rm=200&sp=nrm&clsPage=1&docID=SAG090301174AT1CC2OK |title = About Town |last = Kent |first = Melissa |date = 1 March 2009 |work = [[The Age]] |publisher = [[Fairfax Media]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }} She has made appearances on the improvisational comedy show ''[[Thank God You're Here]]'' and the comedy game show ''[[Talkin' 'Bout Your Generation]]''.{{cite news |url = http://newsstore.fairfax.com.au/apps/viewDocument.ac?page=1&sy=age&kw=Rebel+Wilson+and+Generation&pb=all_ffx&dt=selectRange&dr=entire&so=relevance&sf=text&sf=headline&rc=10&rm=200&sp=nrm&clsPage=1&docID=NCH0905196I6TV6EM3QS |title = Highlights |last = Beaumont |first = Anita |date = 19 May 2009 |work = [[Newcastle Herald]] |publisher = [[Fairfax Media]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }} She performed stand-up on the television special ''The Breast Darn Show In Town'' and guest starred in the [[Seven Network]] drama ''[[City Homicide]]'' and performed improv at the [[Upright Citizens Brigade]] in Los Angeles.{{cite web |url = http://www.throng.com.au/city-homicide/city-homicide-dead-weight-s03e19 |title = City Homicide: Dead Weight – S03E19 |date = 4 November 2009 |publisher = Throng |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }} === Move to Hollywood (2011–present) === After moving to the United States, Wilson signed to talent and literary agents [[William Morris Endeavor]].{{cite news |url = http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/sydney-confidential/our-rebel-wilson-is-matt-lucas-secret-sister-in-next-movie-bridesmaids/story-e6frewz0-1225870281103 |title = Our Rebel Wilson is Matt Lucas' secret sister in next movie Bridesmaids |date = 24 May 2010 |work = [[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]] |publisher = [[News Limited]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }} Wilson's next film role came in the [[Judd Apatow]] film, ''[[Bridesmaids (2011 film)|Bridesmaids]]'', in which she played Brynn, the sister of [[Matt Lucas]]' character. The role was written especially for her. Wilson then appeared in the CBS sitcom ''[[Rules of Engagement (TV series)|Rules of Engagement]]'' and on the [[Comedy Central]] series, ''[[Workaholics]]''.{{cite web |url = http://www.tvtonight.com.au/2010/10/when-rebel-met-joan.html |title = When Rebel met Joan |last = Knox |first = David |date = 21 October 2010 |publisher = [[TV Tonight]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }} She co-hosted the 2010 [[ARIA Music Awards]] and performed at the inaugural ''Variety''’s Power of Comedy event in Los Angeles with Lucas and [[Russell Brand]]. In early 2011, Wilson filmed ''[[A Few Best Men]]'' at Fox Studios Australia.{{cite news |url = http://www.adelaidenow.com.au/aussie-rebel-without-a-pause-in-america/story-e6frf96x-1226063714396 |title = Aussie Rebel without a pause in America |date = 26 May 2011 |work = [[The Advertiser (Adelaide)|The Advertiser]] |publisher = [[News Limited]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }} She also filmed a role in ''[[Small Apartments]]''.{{cite web |url = http://insidemovies.ew.com/2011/07/11/rebel-wilson-what-to-expect-when-youre-expecting |title = 'Bridesmaids' scene-stealer Rebel Wilson joins 'What To Expect When You're Expecting' |last = Murphy |first = Shaunna |date = 11 July 2011 |work = [[Entertainment Weekly]] |publisher = [[Time Warner]] |accessdate = 11 August 2011 }} Wilson was named one of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' magazine's "Top Ten Comics to Watch for 2011". In 2012, Wilson had a role in the ensemble comedy ''[[What to Expect When You're Expecting (film)|What to Expect When You're Expecting]]'', as Janice, and co-starred in the indie film ''[[Struck by Lightning (2012 film)|Struck By Lightning]]''.{{cite web |url = http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118040403 |title = Wilson rides Colfer's 'Lightning' |last = McNary |first = Dave |date = 25 July 2011 |work = [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |publisher = [[Reed Business Information]] |accessdate = 11 August 2011 }} On 19 August 2011, Borys Kit of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' reported that Wilson had replaced [[Casey Wilson]] in ''[[Bachelorette (film)|Bachelorette]]''.{{cite news |url = http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/bridesmaids-star-ramps-up-movie-225490 |title = 'Bridesmaids' Co-Star Ramps Up Movie Roles (Exclusive) |work = [[The Hollywood Reporter]] |publisher = [[Prometheus Global Media]] |date = 19 August 2011 |last = Borys |first = Kit |accessdate = 20 August 2011 }} In 2012, Wilson voiced a character in ''[[Ice Age: Continental Drift]]'' and played Fat Amy in ''[[Pitch Perfect]]''. For the latter role, she received critical acclaim and earned various award nominations, including Best Supporting Actress from the [[San Diego Film Critics Society]] and [[18th Critics' Choice Awards#Best Actress in a Comedy|Best Actress in a Comedy]] from the [[Broadcast Film Critics Association]].{{cite web |url = http://www.sdfcs.org/san-diego-film-critics-nominate-top-films-for-2012 |title = San Diego Film Critics Nominate Top Films for 2012 |date = 9 December 2012 |publisher = [[San Diego Film Critics Society]] |accessdate = 10 December 2012 }}{{cite web |url = http://www.criticschoice.com/movie-awards |title = 'Lincoln' leads the 18th Annual Critics' Choice Movie Awards nominations with a record 13 noms |date = 11 December 2012 |publisher = [[Broadcast Film Critics Association]] |accessdate = 11 December 2012 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20121215082305/http://www.criticschoice.com/movie-awards/ |archivedate = 15 December 2012 |df = dmy-all }} She won the [[MTV Movie Award for Best Actor in a Movie]] and shared the Best Musical Moment award with her ''Pitch Perfect'' co-stars. Wilson was also nominated for [[MTV Movie Award for Best Performance]].{{cite web |url = http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/movies/news/a466341/mtv-movie-awards-2013-the-winners-in-full.html |title = MTV Movie Awards 2013 – The winners in full |date = 15 April 2013 |last = Goodacre |first = Kate |work = [[Digital Spy]] |publisher = [[Hearst Magazines UK]] |accessdate = 15 April 2013 }} Wilson later won the Choice Movie Actress: Comedy award for ''Pitch Perfect'' at the [[2013 Teen Choice Awards]].{{cite news |url = https://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2013/08/11/teen-choice-awards-2013-live-blog |title = Teen Choice Awards 2013: Live Blog |date = 11 August 2013 |work = [[The Wall Street Journal]] |publisher = [[News Corp]] |accessdate = 12 August 2013 }} She had also been nominated for Choice Comedian at the 2013 Teen Choice Awards.{{cite web |url = http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/ustv/news/a483821/teen-choice-awards-2013-first-wave-nominees-in-full.html |title = Teen Choice Awards 2013: First wave nominees in full |last = Wightman |first = Catriona |date = 22 May 2013 |work = [[Digital Spy]] |publisher = [[Hearst Magazines UK]] |accessdate = 22 May 2013 }} In January 2012, [[Michael Ausiello]] of [[TVLine]] announced that Wilson would be writing and starring in ''[[Super Fun Night]]'', a comedy that follows three friends on a quest to have fun every Friday night.{{cite web |url = http://www.tvline.com/2012/01/cbs-pilot-super-fun-night-rebel-wilson |title = Pilot Scoop: CBS Greenlights Super Fun Comedy Starring Bridesmaids Breakout Rebel Wilson |last = Ausiello |first = Michael |authorlink = Michael Ausiello |date = 26 January 2012 |publisher = [[TVLine]] |accessdate = 28 January 2012 }} The pilot was picked up by [[CBS]] and [[Conan O'Brien]] became one of the executive producers. The pilot was later turned down by CBS, but the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] network picked up the project.{{cite web |url = http://www.deadline.com/2012/06/rebel-wilsons-cbs-comedy-pilot-super-fun-night-close-to-new-pilot-order-at-abc |title = Rebel Wilson's CBS Comedy Pilot 'Super Fun Night' Close To New Order At ABC |last = Andreeva |first = Nellie |date = 5 June 2012 |publisher = Deadline.com |accessdate = 6 June 2012 }} A series was ordered and the show began broadcasting on 2 October 2013.{{cite web |url = http://uk.eonline.com/news/417693/abc-scoop-rebel-wilson-s-super-fun-night-bridesmaids-star-s-conan-o-brien-produced-comedy-ordered-to-series |title = News/ABC Scoop: Rebel Wilson's Super Fun Night, Bridesmaids Star's Conan O'Brien-Produced Comedy Ordered to Series |last = Bricker |first = Tierney |date = 10 May 2013 |work = [[E!]] Online |publisher = [[NBCUniversal]] |accessdate = 2 October 2013 }} The series was cancelled after one season.{{cite web |url = http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2014/05/09/suburgatory-canceled-by-abc/262441 |title = 'Suburgatory', 'Super Fun Night' Canceled by ABC |last = Kondolojy |first = Amanda |publisher = [[TV by the Numbers]] |accessdate = 9 May 2014 }} Wilson played Robin Peck in [[Michael Bay]]'s ''[[Pain & Gain]]'' (2013).{{cite web |url = http://insidemovies.ew.com/2012/03/27/rebel-wilson-pain-and-gain |title = Rebel Wilson to Join Michael Bay's True Crime Drama 'Pain and Gain' |last = Vary |first = Adam B. |date = 27 March 2012 |work = [[Entertainment Weekly]] |publisher = [[Time Warner]] |accessdate = 28 March 2012 }}{{cite web |url = http://www.painandgainmovie.com/# |title = Cast – Rebel Wilson |publisher = [[Paramount Pictures]] |accessdate = 28 April 2013 }} She hosted the [[2013 MTV Movie Awards]] on 14 April 2013.{{cite news |url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2251479/Rebel-Wilson-gets-whipped-shape-Matt-Lucas-new-trailer-shes-named-host-MTV-Movie-Awards.html |title = Rebel Wilson named as host of MTV Movie Awards |date = 21 December 2012 |work = [[Daily Mail]] |publisher = [[Associated Newspapers]] |accessdate = 21 December 2012 }} In March 2014, the American [[satellite television]] network [[Dish Network]] launched a marketing campaign for its [[Dish Hopper (DVR)|Hopper]] [[Digital video recorder|DVR]] featuring Wilson as the voice of the eponymous [[Computer animation|computer animated]] [[kangaroo]].{{cite news |url = http://about.dish.com/press-release/corporate/dish-launches-new-marketing-campaign-featuring-voice-award-winning-actress-r |title = DISH Launches New Marketing Campaign Featuring Voice of Award-Winning Actress Rebel Wilson as Hopper the Kangaroo |date = 17 March 2014 |work = [[DISH Network]] |accessdate = 19 June 2014 }} Wilson reprised her role in the sequels ''[[Pitch Perfect 2]]'' (2015) and ''[[Pitch Perfect 3]]'' (2017).{{cite web |url = http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2015/06/15/anna-kendrick-rebel-wilson-pitch-perfect-3_n_7589552.html |title = Anna Kendrick And Rebel Wilson To Return For 'Pitch Perfect 3' |publisher = Huffingtonpost |date = 15 June 2015 }} She also made a cameo in the television comedy ''[[Pompidou (TV series)|Pompidou]]''.{{cite news |url = https://www.theguardian.com/film/2015/may/02/rebel-wilson-pitch-perfect-2-bridesmaids-comedy-boys-club |title = Rebel Wilson: 'Comedy has been a boys' club – until now' |last = Rafanelli |first = Stephanie |date = 11 May 2015 |work = [[The Guardian]] |accessdate = 15 June 2017 }} Wilson joined the voice cast for ''[[Kung Fu Panda 3]]'',{{cite news |url = http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/kung-fu-panda-3-release-788851 |title = 'Kung Fu Panda 3' Release Date Moves Up Two Months |last = Ford |first = Rebecca |date = 14 April 2015 |work = [[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate = 26 January 2016 }} however in September 2015, she was replaced with [[Kate Hudson]].{{cite news |last1 = Kit |first1 = Borys |title = Kate Hudson to Replace Rebel Wilson in 'Kung Fu Panda 3' (Exclusive) |url = http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/kate-hudson-replace-rebel-wilson-820343 |accessdate = 4 September 2015 |work = [[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date = 4 September 2015 }} Wilson next appeared in the ensemble comedy ''[[How to Be Single]]'', released in February 2016.{{cite web |url = http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/dakota-johnson-rebel-wilson-dan-768417 |title = Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Dan Stevens Joining 'How to Be Single' (Exclusive) |last = Ford |first = Rebecca |last2 = Kit |first2 = Borys |date = 29 January 2015 |work = [[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate = 20 March 2015 }} Nigel M Smith of ''[[The Guardian]]'' wrote "Wilson is the standout, nailing every pratfall she's dealt, but ''How to Be Single'' doesn't make strong use of her character".{{cite news |url = https://www.theguardian.com/film/2016/feb/12/how-to-be-single-review-rebel-wilson-dakota-johnson |title = How To Be Single review – Rebel Wilson underused in diverting singleton comedy |last = Smith |first = Nigel M |date = 12 February 2016 |work = [[The Guardian]] |accessdate = 13 February 2016 }} Wilson also appeared in the action comedy ''[[Grimsby (film)|Grimsby]]''.{{cite web |url = https://variety.com/2014/film/news/rebel-wilson-grimsby-sacha-baron-cohen-1201219186 |title = Rebel Wilson Joins Sacha Baron Cohen in Sony's 'Grimsby' (Exclusive) |last = Kroll |first = Justin |work = [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate = 19 June 2014 }} On 14 February 2016, Wilson presented the nominations for the [[BAFTA Award for Best Actor in a Supporting Role|Best Supporting Actor]] category at the [[69th British Academy Film Awards]].{{cite web |last = Horton |first = Helena |url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/baftas/12157086/Rebel-Wilson-calls-Oscars-racist-in-hilarious-Bafta-speech.html |title = Video: Rebel Wilson calls Oscars 'racist' in hilarious Bafta speech |work = [[The Daily Telegraph]] |date = |accessdate = 18 March 2016 }} Wilson is one of sixty celebrities who make a cameo in ''[[Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie]]''.{{cite web |url = http://www.people.com/article/rebel-wilson-officially-making-cameo-ab-fab-movie- |title = Rebel Wilson Shares Pics of Her ''Absolutely Fabulous'' Time on the Set of Upcoming Movie |first = Michael |last = Miller |work = [[People (magazine)|People]] |date = 2 December 2015 |accessdate = 16 May 2016 }} Wilson appeared as [[Ursula (Disney)|Ursula]], the sea witch, in an all-star concert version of ''[[The Little Mermaid (musical)|The Little Mermaid]]'' at the [[Hollywood Bowl]] on 3 June, 4 June, and 6 June 2016.{{cite web |url = http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/music/la-et-cm-little-mermaid-hollywood-bowl-20160601-snapsara-20160601-snap-story.html |title = In a post-'Brave,' post-'Frozen' world, why the time is right for Hollywood Bowl's 'Little Mermaid' |last = Martens |first = Todd |date = 1 June 2016 |publisher = [[Los Angeles Times|latimes.com]] |accessdate = 1 June 2016 }} She made her [[West End Theatre|West End]] debut in the musical ''[[Guys and Dolls]]'' in the role of Miss Adelaide from 28 June to 21 August 2016.{{cite web |url = http://www.whatsonstage.com/london-theatre/news/rebel-wilson-guys-and-dolls-west-end_40656.html |title = Rebel Wilson to make West End debut in Guys and Dolls |publisher = WhatsOnStage |accessdate = 5 August 2016 }} She received positive reviews. Wilson played LeFou in a production of ''Beauty and the Beast: Live in Concert'' at the Hollywood Bowl on 25–26 May 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/movies/news/a858132/rebel-wilson-beauty-and-the-beast-hollywood-bowl-concert-lefou/|title=Rebel Wilson transforms into LeFou for Beauty and the Beast: Live in Concert|last=Houghton|first=Rianne|date=27 May 2018|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=15 June 2018}} She also appeared on the cover of ''[[Vogue Australia]]'' for the first time.{{cite news|url=https://eu.usatoday.com/story/life/entertainthis/2018/05/23/rebel-wilson-covers-vogue-australia-shuts-down-photoshopping-claims/636113002/|title=Rebel Wilson covers 'Vogue Australia,' shuts down Photoshopping accusations on Twitter|last=Moniuszko|first=Sara M|date=23 May 2018|work=[[USA Today]]|accessdate=15 June 2018}} === Upcoming films === Wilson will appear in a remake of ''[[Private Benjamin (1980 film)|Private Benjamin]]''.{{cite web |url = http://www.people.com/article/rebel-wilson-private-benjamin-remake-goldie-hawn-pitch-perfect |title = Rebel Wilson to Star in ''Private Benjamin'' Remake |last = Billups |first = Andrea |date = 9 May 2014 |work = [[People (magazine)|People]] |accessdate = 9 May 2014 }} She has also been cast in ''The Social Life'' alongside [[Amanda Seyfried]].{{cite web |url = http://deadline.com/2014/04/sony-buys-lauryn-kahn-spec-im-in-love-with-the-dj-for-gary-sanchez-716141 |title = Sony Buys Lauryn Kahn Spec 'I'm In Love With The DJ' For Gary Sanchez |last = Fleming, Jr. |first = Mike |date = 17 April 2014 |website=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate = 20 March 2015 }} In August 2016, it was confirmed Wilson would star in a remake of the 1988 comedy film ''[[Dirty Rotten Scoundrels (film)|Dirty Rotten Scoundrels]]''.{{cite news |url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-36991037 |title = Rebel Wilson set for Dirty Rotten Scoundrels remake |date = 5 August 2016 |publisher = [[BBC News]] |accessdate = 5 August 2016 }} The film, titled ''[[The Hustle (2019 film)|The Hustle]]'', will also star [[Anne Hathaway]], while Wilson is co-producing.{{cite web |url = http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/anne-hathaway-joining-rebel-wilson-dirty-rotten-scoundrels-remake-952110 |title = Anne Hathaway Joining Rebel Wilson in 'Dirty Rotten Scoundrels' Remake |last = Ford |first = Rebecca |last2 = Kit |first2 = Borys |date = 19 January 2017 |work = [[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate = 15 June 2017 }} Wilson will also star in the comedy ''[[Isn't It Romantic (2019 film)|Isn't It Romantic]]'', due for release in 2019,{{cite web |url = http://deadline.com/2017/06/betty-gilpin-isnt-it-romantic-movie-casting-rebel-wilson-1202113390/ |title = Betty Gilpin Joins Rebel Wilson In 'Isn't It Romantic' Movie At New Line |last = Hipes |first = Patrick |date = 14 June 2017 |website=Deadline Hollywood |accessdate = 15 June 2017 }} and in [[Taika Waititi]]'s dark comedy drama ''[[Jojo Rabbit]]'' as Fraulein Rahm.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2018/05/rebel-wilson-jojo-rabbit-taika-waititi-wwii-satire-frightening-fraulein-fox-searchlight-1202395823/|title=Rebel Wilson Joins Taika Waititi's WWII Satire 'Jojo Rabbit' As Frightful Fraulein|last=Fleming Jr|first=Mike|date=22 May 2018|publisher=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|accessdate=15 June 2018}} Wilson will produce and star in a feature film adaptation of the [[Image Comics]] comic book ''Crowded''{{cite web |last1=Chitwood |first1=Adam |title=Rebel Wilson to Produce and Star in Comic Adaptation ‘Crowded’ |url=http://collider.com/rebel-wilson-crowded-movie/ |website=Collider |accessdate=June 26, 2018 |date=June 26, 2018}} == Media controversy == In May 2015, Australian magazine ''[[Woman's Day (Australian magazine)|Woman's Day]]'' published a story claiming that Wilson had been misleading about her birth name, age, and upbringing.{{cite web |url = http://www.womansday.com.au/celebrity/australian-celebrities/will-the-real-rebel-wilson-please-stand-up-12574 |title = Separating fact from fiction: Will the real Rebel Wilson please stand up? |work = [[Woman's Day]] |date = 18 May 2015 |accessdate = 11 July 2015 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150521080051/http://www.womansday.com.au/celebrity/australian-celebrities/will-the-real-rebel-wilson-please-stand-up-12574 |archivedate = 21 May 2015 |deadurl = yes |df = dmy-all }} Wilson had previously said in interviews that she was raised by dog-training "[[bogan]]" parents in the [[ghetto]] of Sydney, spent a year in Zimbabwe, climbed into a cage with a leopard, got caught in a shoot-out and then struck down by a severe strain of [[malaria]] from a [[mosquito]] in Mozambique where, from her [[Intensive care unit|intensive care]] bed, she envisioned herself winning an [[Academy Awards|Oscar]] and rapping her acceptance speech.{{cite web |url = http://gulfnews.com/life-style/celebrity/hollywood/rebel-wilson-the-beautiful-bogan-1.1509874 |title = Rebel Wilson: the beautiful bogan |first = Guardian News & Media |last = Ltd |date = 13 May 2015 |publisher = }} Her age was also incorrectly given as 29, which she would later admit was something she chose not to correct. ''Woman's Day'' called all of this into question and claimed that Wilson had, on the contrary, a "very normal, upper-middle-class upbringing" and "added a touch of 'fantasy' to the life she led before becoming a household name." The story was picked up by several other publications including ''[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]'', ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine,{{cite web |url = http://www.people.com/article/rebel-wilson-age-name-melanie-elizabeth-bownds |title = Facts vs. Fibs: Rebel Wilson's Real Age Is 35, Records Confirm |work = [[People (magazine)|People]] |date = 20 May 2015 |first = Tara |last = Fowler |accessdate = 11 July 2015 }} the ''[[Chicago Tribune]]''{{cite web |url = http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/ct-rebel-wilson-age-20150524-story.html |title = Why would Rebel Wilson lie about her age? |work = [[Chicago Tribune]] |date = 24 May 2015 |first = Justin Wm. |last = Moyer |accessdate = 11 July 2015 }} and ''[[The Huffington Post]]''.{{cite web |url = http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2015/05/19/rebel-wilson-name-age_n_7320604.html |title = Rebel Wilson Responds To Claims She's Lying About Her Name And Age |work = [[The Huffington Post]] |date = 19 May 2015 |first = Stephanie |last = Marcus |accessdate = 11 July 2015 }} Most notably, Wilson's true birth date was confirmed through business records filed with the [[Australian Securities and Investment Commission|ASIC]], which were obtained by ''The Sydney Morning Herald''.{{cite web |url = http://www.smh.com.au/lifestyle/celebrity/ls-celebrity-news/rebel-wilsons-birth-date-revealed-in-asic-documents-20150520-gh5caq |title = Rebel Wilson's Birth Date Revealed in ASIC Documents |work = [[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date = 20 May 2015 |accessdate = 11 July 2015 }} On 16 May 2016, Wilson said print and online articles in ''Woman's Day'', the Australian ''Women's Weekly'', ''[[NW (magazine)|NW]]'' and ''OK!'' magazines made her out to be a serial liar. According to a [[defamation]] writ filed in the [[Supreme Court of Victoria]], Wilson said her reputation and credit had suffered and she had been humiliated and embarrassed. She also sued for special damages, claiming she missed out on roles and other ones were terminated because of the articles.{{cite news |url = http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/rebel-wilson-sues-magazine-publisher-over-stories-about-her-age-20160516-gowi9a.html |title = Rebel Wilson sues magazine publisher Bauer Media over stories about her age |last = Ham |first = Larissa |date = 16 May 2016 |work = [[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |accessdate = 16 May 2016 }} Wilson was represented by [[Matthew Collins (barrister)|Matthew Collins QC]]. On 15 June 2017, a six-person jury ruled in Wilson's favour, finding that publisher [[Bauer Media Group]] had indeed wrongly painted the actress as a serial liar, and that publishing the articles was likely to have caused harm to her career.{{cite news |url = https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/jun/15/rebel-wilson-wins-defamation-trial-against-bauer-media |title = Rebel Wilson wins defamation trial against Bauer Media |date = 15 June 2017 |work = [[The Guardian]] |accessdate = 17 June 2017 }} On 13 September 2017, Wilson was awarded {{A$|4500000|link=yes}} in damages. Wilson's lawyer Richard Leder, said "Today's verdict is a significant record—it's about four times the highest previous verdict in a defamation case in Australia". In June 2017, Wilson tweeted "Any dollars I receive will go to charity, scholarships or invested into the Aussie film industry to provide jobs".{{cite web |url = http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-09-13/rebel-wilson-defamation-damages/8936850 |title = Rebel Wilson awarded $4.5m in damages over defamatory magazine articles |date = 13 September 2017 |last1 = Florance |first1 = Loretta |last2 = Younger |first2 = Emma |website = abc.net.au |access-date = 13 September 2017 |dead-url = no |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20170913090952/http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-09-13/rebel-wilson-defamation-damages/8936850 |archive-date = 13 September 2017 }}{{cite web |url = http://www.latimes.com/sns-bc-as--australia-people-rebel-wilson-20170913-story.html |title = Rebel Wilson awarded millions in Australia defamation case |date = 13 September 2017 |website = latimes.com |access-date = 13 September 2017 |dead-url = no |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20170913092858/http://www.latimes.com/sns-bc-as--australia-people-rebel-wilson-20170913-story.html |archive-date = 13 September 2017 }} Bauer Media appealed the amount of the damages.{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/bauer-media-to-appeal-rebel-wilsons-456-million-defamation-win-20171009-gyx148.html|title=Bauer Media to appeal against Rebel Wilson's $4.56 million defamation payout|first=Broede|last=Carmody|date=9 October 2017|publisher=|accessdate=9 October 2017|work=The Sydney Morning Herald}} On 14 June 2018, Bauer Media won its appeal and the damages were reduced to $600,000.{{cite news|url=https://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/movies/court-slashes-rebel-wilson-payout-by-3-9-million-20180614-p4zld6.html|title=Court slashes Rebel Wilson payout by $3.9 million|date=14 June 2018|work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|accessdate=14 June 2018}} Wilson announced her intention to appeal the decision,{{cite web|url=https://www.stuff.co.nz/entertainment/celebrities/104741463/come-on-australia-rebel-wilson-slams-court-of-appeal-decision|title='Come on Australia': Rebel Wilson slams Court of Appeal decision|last=Moran|first=Robert|date=15 June 2018|publisher=[[Stuff.co.nz]]|accessdate=15 June 2018}} and lodged an appeal with the High Court on 11 July 2018.{{cite web |last1=[[Australian Associated Press]] |title=Rebel Wilson to take defamation appeal to Australia's high court |url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2018/jul/12/rebel-wilson-to-take-defamation-appeal-to-australias-high-court |website=[[The Guardian]] |accessdate=28 July 2018 |language=en |date=12 July 2018}} == Personal life == In July 2011, Wilson became a spokesperson for weight loss and nutrition company [[Jenny Craig, Inc.|Jenny Craig]] in Australia.{{cite web |url = http://www.jennycraig.com.au/friendofjenny/rebelwilson/about |title = Rebel Wilson |publisher = Jenny Craig, Australia & New Zealand |accessdate = 15 August 2011 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110720031826/http://www.jennycraig.com.au/friendofjenny/rebelwilson/about/ |archivedate = 20 July 2011 }}{{cite news |url = http://www.heraldsun.com.au/entertainment/confidential/rebel-wilson-seeks-to-slim-down-for-career/story-e6frf96x-1226097108580 |title = Rebel Wilson seeks to slim down for career |date = 19 July 2011 |work = [[Herald Sun]] |publisher = [[The Herald and Weekly Times]] |accessdate = 15 August 2011 }} In January 2012, Wilson told ''[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]]'' that she had lost {{convert|10|kg}} since signing up to the program.{{cite news |url = http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/why-rebel-wilson-will-be-staying-big-in-hollywood/story-e6frewyr-1226250311877 |title = Why Rebel Wilson will be staying big in Hollywood |last = Wigney |first = James |author2 = Halliwell, Elle |date = 22 January 2012 |work = [[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]] |publisher = [[News Limited]] |accessdate = 21 January 2012 }} Wilson asserted that the producers of ''[[Pitch Perfect]]'' had refused to let her lose any more weight during filming, as her contract stated she must stay the same size. She said that once her film commitments were over, she would start her diet again to reach her target weight of {{convert|80|kg}}. In February 2013, she confirmed that she had ended her agreement with Jenny Craig the previous year.{{cite news |url = http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/sydney-confidential/rebel-wilson-talks-on-split-with-jenny-craig/story-e6frewz0-1226580846065 |title = Rebel Wilson talks about split with Jenny Craig |last = Christie |first = Joel |date = 19 February 2013 |work = [[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]] |publisher = [[News Limited]] |accessdate = 22 February 2013 }} Wilson and her ''Bridesmaids'' co-star [[Matt Lucas (comedian)|Matt Lucas]] lived together in [[West Hollywood, California|West Hollywood]],{{cite web |url = http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a403406/bridesmaids-rebel-wilson-matt-lucas-live-together-annoy-neighbours.html |title = 'Bridesmaids' Rebel Wilson, Matt Lucas live together, annoy neighbours |last = Wightman |first = Catriona |date = 3 September 2012 |work = [[Digital Spy]] |publisher = [[Hearst Magazines UK]] |accessdate = 17 January 2013 }} from September 2012 until 2015.{{cite web |url = http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/34384678/matt-lucas-on-rebel-wilson-moving-out-and-being-the-boss |title = Matt Lucas on Rebel Wilson moving out and being the boss |publisher = BBC |date = 29 September 2015 |accessdate = 13 February 2016 }} In July 2015, Wilson stated her support for stricter American gun laws following the [[2015 Lafayette shooting]], stating, "I don't like getting political but America you really have to follow Australia's example re gun laws. I don't remember a mass shooting in Australia since they [[Gun laws in Australia#Port Arthur massacre and its consequences|overhauled the gun laws]]. It seems like every week in America there's a shooting. I just want people to be safe, especially people that are doing one of my favorite things in the world—going out to the movies to have fun."{{cite news |last1 = Derschowitz |first1 = Jessica |title = Rebel Wilson says America needs new gun laws after Lafayette theater shooting |url = http://www.ew.com/article/2015/07/25/rebel-wilson-lafayette-theater-shooting |accessdate = 27 July 2015 |publisher = Entertainment Weekly |date = 25 July 2015 }}{{cite news |title = Rebel Wilson condemns US gun laws |url = http://www.skynews.com.au/culture/showbiz/celebrity/2015/07/26/rebel-wilson-condemns-us-gun-laws.html |accessdate = 27 July 2015 |publisher = Sky News |date = 26 July 2015 }}{{cite news |last1 = Noyes |first1 = Jenny |title = Rebel Wilson speaks out about gun control after 'Trainwreck' shooting in Louisiana |url = http://www.dailylife.com.au/dl-people/celebrity-news/rebel-wilson-speaks-out-about-gun-control-after-trainwreck-shooting-in-louisiana-20150725-gikcs8.html?eid=socialn%3Afac-14omn0013-optim-nnn%3Anonpaid-25062014-social_traffic-all-organicpost-nnn-smh-o&campaign_code=nocode&promote_channel=social_facebook |accessdate = 27 July 2015 |publisher = Daily Life |date = 25 July 2015 }} == Filmography == === Film === {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- !
